t: Mark 2
The Son of Man Forgives and Heals
When*p he entered Capernaum again after some days, it was reported that he was at home.
So many people gathered together that there was no more room, not even in the doorway, and he was speaking the word to them.
They came to him bringing a paralytic, carried by four of them.
Since they were not able to bring him to Jesus because of the crowd, they removed the roof above him, and after digging through it, they lowered the mat on which the paralytic was lying.
Seeing their faith, Jesus told the paralytic, “Son,*r your*r sins*r are*r forgiven.”*r
But*p some of the scribes were sitting there, questioning in their hearts:
“Why does he speak like this? He’s blaspheming! Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
Right*p away Jesus perceived in his spirit that they were thinking like this within themselves and said to them, “Why*r are*r you*r thinking*r these*r things*r in*r your*r hearts?*r
Which*r is*r easier:*r to*r say*r to*r the*r paralytic,*r ‘Your*r sins*r are*r forgiven,’*r or*r to*r say,*r ‘Get*r up,*r take*r your*r mat,*r and*r walk’?*r
But*r so*r that*r you*r may*r know*r that*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r has*r authority*r on*r earth*r to*r forgive*r sins”-*r he told the paralytic —
“I*r tell*r you:*r get*r up,*r take*r your*r mat,*r and*r go*r home.”*r
Immediately*p he got up, took the mat, and went out in front of everyone. As a result, they were all astounded and gave glory to God, saying, “We have never seen anything like this!”
The Call of Levi
Jesus*p went out again beside the sea. The whole crowd was coming to him, and he was teaching them.
Then, passing by, he saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax office, and he said to him, “Follow*r me,”*r and he got up and followed him.
While*p he was reclining at the table in Levi’s house, many tax collectors and sinners were eating with Jesus and his disciples, for there were many who were following him.
When the scribes who were Pharisees saw that he was eating with sinners and tax collectors, they asked his disciples, “Why does he eat with tax collectors and sinners?”

When*p Jesus heard this, he told them, “It*r is*r not*r those*r who*r are*r well*r who*r need*r a*r doctor,*r but*r those*r who*r are*r sick.*r I*r didn’t*r come*r to*r call*r the*r righteous,*r but*r sinners.”*r
A Question about Fasting
Now*p John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting. People came and asked him, “Why do John’s disciples and the Pharisees’ disciples fast, but your disciples do not fast?”

Jesus*p said to them, “The*r wedding*r guests*r cannot*r fast*r while*r the*r groom*r is*r with*r them,*r can*r they?*r As*r long*r as*r they*r have*r the*r groom*r with*r them,*r they*r cannot*r fast.*r
But*r the*r time*r will*r come*r when*r the*r groom*r will*r be*r taken*r away*r from*r them,*r and*r then*r they*r will*r fast*r on*r that*r day.*r
No*r one*r sews*r a*r patch*r of*r unshrunk*r cloth*r on*r an*r old*r garment.*r Otherwise,*r the*r new*r patch*r pulls*r away*r from*r the*r old*r cloth,*r and*r a*r worse*r tear*r is*r made.*r

And*r no*r one*r puts*r new*r wine*r into*r old*r wineskins.*r Otherwise,*r the*r wine*r will*r burst*r the*r skins,*r and*r the*r wine*r is*r lost*r as*r well*r as*r the*r skins.*r No,*r new*r wine*r is*r put*r into*r fresh*r wineskins.”*r
Lord of the Sabbath
On*p the Sabbath he was going through the grainfields, and his disciples began to make their way, picking some heads of grain.
The Pharisees said to him, “Look, why are they doing what is not lawful on the Sabbath?”
He*p said to them, “Have*r you*r never*r read*r what*r David*r and*r those*r who*r were*r with*r him*r did*r when*r he*r was*r in*r need*r and*r hungry—*r

how*r he*r entered*r the*r house*r of*r God*r in*r the*r time*r of*r Abiathar*r the*r high*r priest*r and*r ate*r the*r bread*r of*r the*r Presence*r — which*r is*r not*r lawful*r for*r anyone*r to*r eat*r except*r the*r priests*r — and*r also*r gave*r some*r to*r his*r companions?”*r
Then he told them, “The*r Sabbath*r was*r made*r for*r man*r and*r not*r man*r for*r the*r Sabbath.*r
So*r then,*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r Lord*r even*r of*r the*r Sabbath.”*r
